intro: Hordelymus europaeus, commonly known as the European hound's tongue, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves and a flowering stem that bears small, greenish-yellow flowers. It produces small, round, black fruits that are often used as a spice in some cuisines. Hordelymus europaeus is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
